frameDefinitions: A person or group, the Authority, believes that another person, the Suspect is a participant in a criminal Incident.

The words in this frame describe situations in which the Perpetrator secretly takes Goods into or out of a country or other area which are prohibited by law or on which one has not paid the required duty.
This frame contains adjectives and nouns that describe the truth or sincerity of communication.
A Tester uses a concrete or conceptual Product in order to determine either whether it works or to find out how well or in which manner it works.
A Phenomenon, which may be an activity, state or object, is purposefully hidden from the awareness of a potential Cognizer.

A Figure is located relative to a (presumably more easily located) Ground, asserting that the Figure lies (approximately) on line from the Ground whose direction is established by semantic types of the particular LUs.
frameExamples: The police <t>suspect</t> Noah Rogers of aiding the robbery last night at Shop-n-drive.
Evelyn was <t>candid</t> with me about the party.
Sun has (hopefully) already <t>tested</t> it for compliance.
Few people would use ATMs if the content of their transaction was <t>secret</t> from their bank and there was no paper trail verifying the transaction. .
The plane landed 10 miles due <t>north</t> of Lake Travis in an empty field .
listRoleDefinitions: The <fen>Authority</fen> is the group or person who suspects the <fen>Suspect</fen> of criminal activity.
The <fen>Suspect</fen> is the target of the <fen>Authority</fen>'s suspicion.
The (typically criminal) <fen>Incident</fen> in which the <fen>Suspect</fen> is suspected of being involved.
When the suspecting takes place.
This is the person (or other agent) that illegally takes the goods into or out of a country.
The role Goods is anything (including labor, time, or legal rights) that can be illegally taken into our out of a country.
The source is the location the goods occupy initially before change of location.
The path refers to (a part of the) ground the Goods travel over or to a landmark the Goods travel by.
Goal is the location the Goods end up in.
When the event occurs.
Where the event takes place.

The <fen>Speaker</fen> produces the <fen>Message</fen>, the truth or sincerity of which is at issue. It is normally expressed as the External Argument of predicative uses of the <t>target</t> word, or as the Nominal Head of prenominal uses.

<fen>Message</fen> is the communicative content whose truth or sincerity is at issue. This role does not normally co-occur with the other FEs in this frame. When it does occur, it is normally the External Argument of a predicative use of the <t>Target</t> word, or the modified Nominal Head in a prenominal use.

The <fen>Topic</fen> is the subject matter to which the <fen>Message</fen> pertains. It often occurs without the <fen>Message</fen> role in predicative uses of the <t>target</t> word. It is normally expressed as a PP Complement headed by 'about'.
<fen>Medium</fen> is the physical or abstract setting in which the <fen>Message</fen> is conveyed.
The person who uses  the <fen>Product</fen> to see if it is intact or to ascertain its characteristics during operation.
The entity that the <fen>Tester</fen> uses  to ascertain whether it is intact.
An entity or property whose presence would impair the acceptability or usefulness of the <fen>Product</fen>.
An action that the <fen>Tester</fen> intends to accomplish subjecting the <fen>Product</fen> to a test of its functioning.
The desirable state of affairs which the <fen>Tester</fen> hopes to find to obtain when using the <fen>Product</fen>.
A variable of behavior of the <fen>Product</fen> which is specifically evaluated.
The <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Tester</fen> uses  the <fen>Product</fen> to evaluate its functioning.
The location in which the test is carried out.
The <fen>Phenomenon</fen> is the activity, state or object that is purposefully hidden from the awareness of a potential cognizer.
A period of <fen>Time</fen> during which the <fen>Phenomenon</fen> is hidden from the awareness of potential cognizers.
The <fen>Ground</fen> serves as a basis for describing the location of the <fen>Figure</fen>.

The <fen>Figure</fen> is perceived as located relative to a certain <fen>Ground</fen> location in a certain direction specified by the particular LU. The <fen>Figure</fen> can be an entity or an event.
The period of time during which the locative relation between <fen>Figure</fen> and <fen>Ground</fen> obtains.
listRoleExamples: Jakobson was placed under suspicion <fex>last week</fex> .
Evelyn made some candid remarks <fex>in French</fex>.
I just wish <fex>we</fex> could have tested the car with a manual gearbox, instead of the five-speed automatic
To ensure that the remedy is complete, nCipher have fully reviewed the software and tested it <fex>for similar errors</fex>.
Once you have copied your site and have tested it <fex>to make sure it works normally</fex>, you're ready to pull out the scalpel and start hacking away.
Test-Driven Development requires you to set an expectation of a result and then test <fex>that the result is achieved</fex>.
ILCSO staff have tested <fex>the behavior of the ILCSO-standard version of WebVoyage with several browsers</fex>.
We tested the product <fex>in California</fex> first.
There was stuff in there that was 'secret' <fex>in the 1980s</fex>, but has since become pretty common knowledge.
He was north of the park <fex>on Friday</fex>.

sourceCandidateSpans.text: the International Court of Arbitration at The Hague
